headline.main: A Problem in Following Doctor's Orders

docs.abstract: It was a year into our relationship when my patient finally told me the truth. No wonder he couldn't keep his medications straight.
docs.snippet: It was a year into our relationship when my patient finally told me the truth. No wonder he couldn't keep his medications straight.

docs.lead_paragraph: A survey of the human genome shows that common diseases are likely to have a different set of genetic roots in Africans, East Asians and Europeans.

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientists are building electronic and chemical sniffers that analyze breath to detect problems ranging from kidney disease to cancer.

headline.seo: Breath Analyzers, Seeking Telltale Signs of Disease
headline.main: Beyond the Breathalyzer: Seeking Telltale Signs of Disease
headline.print_headline: Beyond the Breathalyzer: Seeking Telltale Signs of Disease

docs.snippet: Scientists are building electronic and chemical sniffers that analyze breath to detect problems ranging from kidney disease to cancer.

docs.lead_paragraph: PEOPLE who are worried about bad breath often reach for a toothbrush, a Tic Tac or an Altoid. But in the future, personal breath monitoring may include far more than breath fresheners.

headline.main: Beyond the Breathalyzer: Seeking Telltale Signs of Disease

docs.abstract: Anne Eisenberg Novelties column on effort to build electronic and chemical breath monitors that examine puffs of exhaled air for telltale signs of various diseases, as well as for radiation exposure; photos (M)
docs.snippet: PEOPLE who are worried about bad breath often reach for a toothbrush, a Tic Tac or an Altoid.     But in the future, personal breath monitoring may include far more than breath fresheners.
